Reason: The configuration option 'internode_streaming_tcp_user_timeout_in_ms' in the 'cassandra' software project is performance-sensitive because changing its value can significantly impact the communication and data transfer between nodes in the cluster. A lower timeout value may lead to quicker detection of unresponsive nodes but could also result in increased retransmissions and potential performance degradation. On the other hand, a higher timeout value may delay the detection of node failures, impacting the overall system availability and responsiveness.
